top_categories.workout_context: Torino Nice Rally’s 435-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.

Torino Nice Rally’s mixed alpine terrain - paved cols, military gravel roads, rocky doubletrack and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Every session at Torino Nice Rally intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Torino Nice Rally’s paved alpine roads, military gravel roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Torino Nice Rally isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Torino Nice Rally when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
At 435 miles, Torino Nice Rally rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Torino Nice Rally’s 52,493ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Torino Nice Rally rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Torino Nice Rally — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Torino Nice Rally’s mixed alpine terrain - paved cols, military gravel roads, rocky doubletrack delivers on race day.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Torino Nice Rally — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on mixed alpine terrain - paved cols, military gravel roads, rocky doubletrack.

race_overlay.heat: September in Turin, Italy to Nice, France can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Torino Nice Rally. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 435 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 435 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Torino Nice Rally with 52,493ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Torino Nice Rally demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed alpine terrain - paved cols, military gravel roads, rocky doubletrack at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: paved alpine roads, military gravel roads, rough doubletrack. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 435 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, VO2max, and Endurance to prepare you for 435 miles of mixed alpine terrain - paved cols, military gravel roads, rocky doubletrack in Turin, Italy to Nice, France.
